bullets.text: Fed minutes reveal deep split on policy; December rate cut lacks majority support amid sticky inflation risks and data uncertainty.
Labor Department says some October employment data lost to shutdown; BLS will roll partial figures into next report, muddying near-term economic signals.
Trump signals desire to fire Powell, presses aides to push for lower rates, raising renewed questions about Fed independence.
Nvidia posts record $57B revenue and 65% profit jump, issues hotter-than-expected outlook, igniting global chip rally and easing AI-bubble fears.
Nvidia discloses no assurance of finalizing $100B OpenAI pact, underscoring deal risk even amid surging AI demand.
Alphabet surges on optimism around Gemini 3 AI model, signaling competitive pressure on Microsoft in core AI capabilities.
Saudi Arabia’s PIF strapped for cash even as Kingdom pursues AI-data centers and rare earth projects with U.S. partners, complicating geopolitical-industrial ambitions.
Mexico becomes top buyer of U.S. goods, highlighting nearshoring shift and deepening North American supply-chain integration.
Reported U.S.-Russia draft peace plan would require Ukraine to cede territory and shrink military, signaling potential geopolitical realignment pressures.
Rising data-center electricity demand heightens blackout risks during winter storms, stressing grids and investment needs.
Crypto exchange Kraken confidentially files for IPO after $800M raise, testing public-market appetite amid bitcoin downturn below $90,000.
mRNA flu vaccines advancing through clinical trials, promising faster strain updates and broader protection versus conventional shots.
Studies link everyday microplastics exposure to cardiovascular pathology, suggesting a modifiable environmental risk factor for heart disease.
Simple small molecule shows marked Alzheimer’s reversal in rats, offering a new therapeutic pathway pending human validation.
Meta’s chief AI scientist Yann LeCun departs to found startup, signaling intensifying talent competition in foundational AI.
